intro: Coleataenia scabrida, commonly known as the rough-leaved corymbiferous plant, is a flowering plant species native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or rocky hillsides. Coleataenia scabrida is valued for its ornamental appeal and has limited uses in traditional medicine.
